data.title: Spanish Super Cup winners list: Get to know all the winners by year
data.meta_description: The Spanish Super Cup is a competition which matches the Copa del Rey victor vs the League champion. Read on to explore the Spanish Super Cup winners list.
data.text:
Playing the victor of the Copa del Rey against the champion of the Spanish League in the Spanish Super Cup is an essential tradition in Spanish football. An additional variation of this format is the four-team final, which can take place over one or two legs (home and away) and features the Cup winner and the La Liga runner-up. Let us take a closer look at the Spanish Super Cup winners list.

Table of Сontents:

On the field, the Spanish Super Cup witnessed some of the most memorable and intense contests in the history of Spanish football. Renown teams have risen to prominence, and worthy champions have been announced throughout the competition's history.

Spanish Super Cup winners list of all-time

Winners of the Spanish Super Cup have come from all walks of life. Naturally, FC Barcelona and Real Madrid have enormous dominance, as is typical in Spain. Based on the Sporting News, the Spanish Super Cup winners' list is below by year.

Sporting Lisbon legends: Top 10 all-time greats for the Leões

Football

Atletico de Madrid holds the number three spot. On the other hand, Real Zaragoza, Valencia, Sevilla FC, Deportivo de La Coruña, Athletic de Bilbao, RCD Mallorca, and Real Sociedad are among the other teams that have won at least one trophy. Among the list, only two clubs have not been Spanish Super Cup winners Since 2000.

Top 5 best Spanish Super Cup winners

5. Atletico Madrid (2)

Atletico Madrid boasts a two-time trophy winner on their roster. In 1985, Atletico became one of the most potent teams in Spain by winning their first championship. However, their most recent championship was in 2014, when they defeated their opponents 2-1 against past winners Real Madrid.

Who is Xavi Hernandez? All the details and facts on one of the greatest midfielders ever

Football

4. Deportivo La Coruña (3)

With three each, Athletic Bilbao and Deportivo La Coruna are tied for fourth place. La Corua first won the title in 1995, and they repeated the feat in 2000. 2002 was their most recent triumph. Following their win in 2002, they have won Spanish Super Cup Winners once since 2000.

3. Athletic Bilbao (3)

Apart from Real Madrid and Barcelona, Athletic Club Bilbao is among the most successful Spanish teams. They have won more domestic titles than any other team. Previous winners like the Bilbao Club have won the Spanish Super Cup thrice. Despite Bilbao's two second-place finishes, the team never lost in the tournament until the semi-finals. Not to mention the 2020–2021/2021, 2015, and 1984 campaigns.

2. Real Madrid (13)

Real Madrid has the second-most victories in this trophy's history. With twelve trophies, they are one short of matching Barcelona's record of thirteen.

Spain World Cup squad 2022: Which players will represent the Red Fury this World Cup?

Football

When Madrid initially competed in the Supercopa de Espana in 1988, they won all three years (1988–89, 1990). Success came pouring in for Los Blancos after that. Over the next decade, they garnered five awards. Still, from 1988 through 2019, they were champions on ten separate occasions.

1. Barcelona (14)

Barcelona tops the Spanish Super Cup list of winners with fourteen. On top of that, save Real Madrid they have more domestic championships than any other team in Spain.

In 1983, Barcelona achieved its first championship. After Barca won a title in 1991, she continued dancing for another eight years. Along with its lone domestic Cup victory, Barcelona has placed second on eleven occasions and advanced to the semifinals on a single occasion. However, in 1983, 1991, 1992, 1994, 1996, 2005, 2006, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2013, 2016, 2018, and 2023, they were the ones who brought home the hardware.

Switzerland World Cup squad 2022: Who's in and who's out?

Football

Trivia

Who has won the most Spanish Super Cup?

Every year, Spanish football clubs compete for the trophy. Barcelona holds the record for the most championships won by a team of fourteen in the competition.

Who is the top scorer in the Spanish Super Cup?

Compared to Raúl González Blanco, Leo Messi has a far higher number of goals. The talented Argentine scored fourteen goals in twenty outings as a member of FC Barcelona. Cristiano Ronaldo scored four goals in seven games, three less than Real Madrid's Raul and Karim Benzema, who scored seven goals.

How many Spanish Super Cups has Ronaldo won?

In team history, the Portuguese forward scored the most goals by a Real Madrid player. His prize tally as a player is incredible, with four Champions League wins, three Club World Cups and UEFA Super Cups each, two La Liga crowns, two Copas del Rey, and two Spanish Super Cups.

15 times Lionel Messi surprised the football world, is he the GOAT?

Football

When was the Spanish Super Cup uncontested?

Since Real Madrid and Athletic Bilbao each won twice in 1984 and 1989, respectively, the trophy remained uncontested in those years. Teams were invited to the Supercopa if they finished second in the Copa del Rey the previous season and vice versa if they had won the league and trophy the year before. The practice persists to this day.

Why is the Spanish Super Cup played in Saudi Arabia?

The competition's concept, location, and timing have all changed significantly in recent years. A three-year, four-team Supercopa will be held in the Gulf state in January, the new mid-season month, per an agreement reached in 2019 between the Saudi Arabian government and the Royal Spanish Football Federation (RFEF).

Final word

is a history of the successes and setbacks, victories and setbacks that have shaped Spanish football over the years. The Spanish Super Cup is still a celebration of the beautiful game and an exhibition of the timeless spirit of competitiveness; even as it changes, new players emerge, and long-standing favourites reinforce their domination.

Uruguay's World Cup squad 2022: Which players represented Uruguay in this World Cup?

Football

The Spanish Super Cup winners list is a record of the triumphs and tragedies, the winners and losers, that have moulded Spanish football throughout the years. Even while it evolves, new players emerge, and established favourites solidify their dominance. The Spanish Super Cup remains a tribute to the beautiful game and demonstrates everlasting competitiveness.
